basejump 0.6.3

Unite Interesting Groups

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/uniteInterestingGroups-methods.R
uniteInterestingGroups.Rd

Create a single interesting groups column ("interestingGroups") used for coloring in plots. When multiple interesting groups are present, unite into a single column, delimited by a colon.

uniteInterestingGroups(object, ...)

# S4 method for data.frame
uniteInterestingGroups(object, interestingGroups)

# S4 method for DataFrame
uniteInterestingGroups(object, interestingGroups)

# S4 method for tbl_df
uniteInterestingGroups(object, interestingGroups)

Arguments

object

Object containing multiple interesting groups.
...

Additional arguments.
interestingGroups

character. Groups of interest.

Value

Data frame containing an interestingGroups column.

See also

Other Data Functions: aggregateFeatures, aggregateReplicates, counts, gene2symbol, sampleData, sampleNames, selectSamples

Examples

x <- sampleData(rse_bcb)
y <- uniteInterestingGroups(x, interestingGroups = c("treatment", "day"))
y[["interestingGroups"]]
#> control_rep1 control_rep2 control_rep3 fa_day7_rep1 fa_day7_rep2 fa_day7_rep3 
#>    control:0    control:0    control:0 folic_acid:7 folic_acid:7 folic_acid:7 
#> Levels: control:0 folic_acid:7
